intro: Lantanopsis hispidula, commonly known as the rough lantanopsis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. Its leaves are typically hairy, giving it a rough texture, and it thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. Lantanopsis hispidula is often found in open woodlands and along riverbanks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
